titleStmt.title: L. VanHook et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4951

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Gov. Thos. E. Bramlette

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that at the May term 1864 of the Harrison Circuit Court a judgement was rendered upon a forfeited recognizance in the case of the comlth of Ky. against Wesley Barrett & Jno. A. Kirkpatric who were sureties for Jno. W. Phillips indicted for the murder of Henry Whalen We believe that said sureties used extraordinary efforts to have Philips brought to trial in said case he had been once tried and the jury disagreed: the sureties are peaceable good citizens and we think their case is a proper one for the exercise of executive clemency We therefore respectfully ask that said judgement for $1000- be remitted except the percentage of Comlths' atty & officers fees

L VanHook
Jno. M. Kinbrough
David Veach
Charles T. Wilson Clk H Co Ct.
James G. Wall
J F Ware. Clk H Circt Ct-
C. Walton
Jno. L. Mager
J. S. Frizell
C. G. Land
T. V. Dills
John Bruce
John St. John
Wm Mchowrse
Morrsion Smith
H Kimbraugh
F. M. Gray
G. H. Given
T. R. Rankin
J W Fightmarter
P. Wherritt
Wm. T. Magee
J B McClintock S H C

Harrison Circuit Court
vs
Wesley Barnett &
Jno A Kirkpatrick
B
